caseStudy.title: Migraines as Secondary to Tinnitus
caseStudy.excerpt: Early-2000s Air Force veteran • Long-term headaches • No in-service documentation
caseStudy.content_html: VA denied migraines as “not related” to service or any service‑connected disabilities, despite long‑term headache complaints.
caseStudy.challenge: VA denied migraines as “not related” to service or any service‑connected disabilities, despite long‑term headache complaints.
caseStudy.solution:
• Longstanding headache complaints
  • Recent formal diagnosis of migraine disorder
  • Existing service connection for chronic tinnitus

The record lacked a clear medical explanation tying migraines to existing service‑connected issues.
caseStudy.results:
• Physiologic explanation of how Tinnitus can trigger migraine patterns
  • Chronological analysis of Tinnitus, and migraine onset
  • Structured opinion supporting migraines as secondary to service‑connected conditions.
caseStudy.key_takeaway: After the secondary nexus opinion was added to the file, the veteran later received a favorable VA decision granting migraines as secondary to service‑connected disabilities.
